content.text: RNTC was set up in 1968 as a joint initiative of RNW Media (formerly Radio Netherlands Worldwide) and the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Over the past 50 years, RNTC has gained invaluable expertise in delivering courses to media professionals around the world and has trained over 6000 journalist and media professionals. Whether you are a journalist, a blogger or a media manager, we have the courses to fit your needs. RNTC offers courses in Hilversum, the Netherlands, and in-house courses around the world. We also provide tailor-made training for media organisations and non-governmental organisations. RNTC prides itself on being innovative in both subject matter and method of delivery.

Digital technologies have fundamentally changed the nature and function of media in our society. They’ve reinvented age-old practices of public communication, going beyond traditional media and challenging its privileged role as the gatekeeper of news and entertainment.
Traditional old school media outlets like TV, radio and print have all had to expand to include digital extensions in order to keep their audience engaged.

Today, digital content creatives have a duty to publish accurate and compelling stories to targeted audiences while being engaging and “share-worthy.” Above all, your content must stand out in a highly competitive market.  The RTNC Digital Content Creative course will take your abilities from “good” to “great”, empowering you to shake up your industry through powerful and engaging content.
How to produce a wide range of exciting content in multiple formats
Practicing the latest multimedia and online content creation techniques
Gaining competence and confidence in both broadcast and multimedia journalism
Learning how to capture the attention of your audience through storytelling

Digital technologies have fundamentally changed the nature and function of media in our society. They’ve reinvented age-old practices of public communication, going beyond traditional media and challenging its privileged role as the gatekeeper of news and entertainment.
Traditional old school media outlets like TV, radio and print have all had to expand to include digital extensions in order to keep their audience engaged.

Today, digital content creatives have a duty to publish accurate and compelling stories to targeted audiences while being engaging and “share-worthy.” Above all, your content must stand out in a highly competitive market.  The RTNC Digital Content Creative course will take your abilities from “good” to “great”, empowering you to shake up your industry through powerful and engaging content.
How to produce a wide range of exciting content in multiple formats
Practicing the latest multimedia and online content creation techniques
Gaining competence and confidence in both broadcast and multimedia journalism
Learning how to capture the attention of your audience through storytelling

Upon graduation, you’ll be able to tackle your career with a fresh mindset and new skills learned from like-minded, successful professionals. Along with your creative abilities, you’ll also have refined your ability to:
Engage with your audience by telling powerful stories, feeling equally confident in both broadcast and multimedia journalism
Work with more than 100 broadcast and multimedia formats
Put powerful stories at the heart of your work, to deliver narrative-driven, meaningful content
Be competent in researching, writing, producing and publishing compelling stories for broadcast and the web
Drawing larger audiences and engaging them in new ways, using social media
Generate creative story ideas and turn them into persuasive content for broadcast and the web
Know how to capture your audience’s attention by harnessing the power of ‘what happened next?'

location.name: RNTC Media Training Centre, part of RNW Media

content.text: Public Interest Journalism is about delivering powerful stories that have an impact on society, with the sole objective of exposing the truth – think Panama Papers.

Predominantly used to expose abuse of power in government, corporate corruption and social injustices, it’s an integral form of communication that relays uncomfortable yet vital truths to the public, while putting pressure on those in power.  You will work with world-renowned, award-winning investigative journalist, Janet Anderson and other leading journalists in their fields, to hone your skills in:
Efficient and accurate research
Identifying issues of governance
Establishing misuse of power
Story structure and writing
Public Interest Journalism is about delivering powerful stories that have an impact on society, with the sole objective of exposing the truth – think Panama Papers.

Predominantly used to expose abuse of power in government, corporate corruption and social injustices, it’s an integral form of communication that relays uncomfortable yet vital truths to the public, while putting pressure on those in power.  You will work with world-renowned, award-winning investigative journalist, Janet Anderson and other leading journalists in their fields, to hone your skills in:
Efficient and accurate research
Identifying issues of governance
Establishing misuse of power
Story structure and writing
Learning essential methods and techniques required to research, cross-check, and structure stories to reveal authentic information
Learn to utilize unique media formats to present in-depth stories that make an impact on public awareness
Understanding a journalist’s role in maintaining good governance and democratic principles, for the benefit of humanity.
Learning how to protect your data and stay safe online as well
Developing  your emotional and mental resiliency
Exploring how to implement investigative journalism in small newsrooms
Developing your writing ability to translate your scoop into a story that appeals to your audience

location.name: RNTC Media Training Centre, part of RNW Media

products.title: Counter Disinformation and Hate Speech with Digital Media - In-Person
products.english_title: Counter Disinformation and Hate Speech with Digital Media - In-Person

content.text: When facts and fact checking alone is not enough, what else can be done to turn the tide on disinformation, misinformation, polarisation, propaganda, and hate speech? With the advent of the digital age, these last decades have seen new and worrisome phenomena affecting people and politics worldwide. This course offers unique perspectives for those working online and dealing with these complex issues.  Combining state of the art techniques on media literacy, alternate messaging and campaigning, Digital Media to Counter Disinformation and Hate Speech explores what can be done to fight back.
In this course you will learn:
Strategies used to identify disinformation, malinformation, polarisation, and propaganda
How to use creative techniques to deliver alternative narratives to micro-target audiences
Skills to monitor and track hate speech and polarising narratives and how to deal with the issues proactively before they attack
How to moderate communities for inclusive dialogue

When facts and fact checking alone is not enough, what else can be done to turn the tide on disinformation, misinformation, polarisation, propaganda, and hate speech? With the advent of the digital age, these last decades have seen new and worrisome phenomena affecting people and politics worldwide. This course offers unique perspectives for those working online and dealing with these complex issues.  Combining state of the art techniques on media literacy, alternate messaging and campaigning, Digital Media to Counter Disinformation and Hate Speech explores what can be done to fight back.
In this course you will learn:
Strategies used to identify disinformation, malinformation, polarisation, and propaganda
How to use creative techniques to deliver alternative narratives to micro-target audiences
Skills to monitor and track hate speech and polarising narratives and how to deal with the issues proactively before they attack
How to moderate communities for inclusive dialogue
By the end of this course you will be able to:
Design and produce emotional narratives
Address the root of radical ideologies, propaganda, and hate messaging
Produce online video which change attitudes and behaviours: shooting and editing on a smart phone
Use moderation in online communities to reduce hate speech and polarisation

location.name: RNTC Media Training Centre, part of RNW Media

products.title: Media Campaigns for Social Change and Advocacy - In-Person
products.english_title: Media Campaigns for Social Change and Advocacy - In-Person

content.text: Are you looking to make a positive impact on the world? Have you got an important message to share? Media campaigns can be an effective conduit for social change. Campaigns that spark a conversation about our current culture, when crafted correctly, are a powerful tool for heightening awareness, shifting mindsets and changing behaviour. If we want to create change, we need to work on the legal context. RNTC puts an emphasis on building engaging campaigns for advocacy and how to leverage media and others to amplify efforts. Our Media Campaigns for Social Change and Advocacy course allows you to explore the ingredients of successful campaigns and advocacy strategies and gives you the practical tools to create your own.
In this course you will learn how to :
Develop a campaign plan for your own context
Use the power of persuasion to attract and retain new audiences
Use digital and social media tools
Utilise offline interventions and engagement strategies
Create campaigns that have a measurable impact on society
Define the key elements of advocacy and amplification

Outline an advocacy strategy plan
Develop engaging and targeted campaigns with advocacy aims

location.name: RNTC Media Training Centre, part of RNW Media

products.title: Storytelling to Inspire Social Change - In person
products.english_title: Storytelling to Inspire Social Change - In person

content.text: Effective storytelling involves a deep understanding of human emotions, motivations, and psychology in order to truly move anaudience. Combining the fundamental building blocks of the RNTC approach, the “Reach your Audience with Storytelling” course will give you the techniques needed, to move you from goodstorytelling togreatstorytelling.

RNTC believes that information is not enough tochange anaudience’s beliefs or behaviors. Information is quickly forgotten if it isn’t presented ina way we can remember it and we have all experienced confusion when trying to understand a new idea. Stories provide a way around that.This 4-day combination of modules will give you the skills to create strong narratives, find the right media formats toconvey them, and capture your audiences. You will practice identifying and mapping target audiences and persuading them. You will feel up to speed with the latest insights into modern-day journalism. You will put the theory into practice with real examples and try the techniques out for yourself. In this course you will learn:
How to identify and map your target audience
Key techniques you can use to persuade your audience
The eight essential elements of storytelling
Creative media formats you can use to engage your audience

✔ Map audience beliefs and emotional pay-offs ✔ Produce persuasive stories that have measurable impact ✔ Produce persuasive stories in various media formats

location.name: RNTC Media Training Centre, part of RNW Media

products.title: Podcast Essentials: Audio Production for Social Change - In Person
products.english_title: Podcast Essentials: Audio Production for Social Change - In Person

content.text: For creators and organisations who are looking to amplify their message and expand their reach, podcasting is quickly becoming one of the best ways to communicate with your audience. Audio is a portable, accessible, and convenient means for listeners to engage with your content throughout their daily activities. Podcasts provide a powerful way to bring stories to life, engage with diverse guests and introduce new perspectives. At RNW Media, we believe that podcasting can help inform and surprise your listeners as well as drive them to social change. But in order to craft powerful audio stories and capture your audience’s attention, you will need to hone your production and narrative skills. Our training enables you to understand the medium of podcasting and master the basics of audio production. We highlight the unique strengths and challenges of podcasting as well as how to maximise its potential to best engage with your audience. We also provide tools and techniques that can help turn your message into immersive, compelling episodes. This training covers the key aspects of bringing your podcast to life: from scripting to recording to publishing - and everything in between! The training is hands-on, and participants are encouraged to both brainstorm and develop their podcast idea but also record and edit a sound bite/short podcast.

After completing this training, you will be able to:
Analyse the podcasting landscape and trends
Identify different podcast formats, genres, and narratives
Write for the ear and successfully structure audio content
Discern best practices for podcasting and review effective case studies
Record and edit high-quality audio

location.name: RNTC Media Training Centre, part of RNW Media

products.title: Video Essentials: Audio-Visual Production for Social Change - In Person
products.english_title: Video Essentials: Audio-Visual Production for Social Change - In Person

content.text: Video is one of the most popular media types in the world: there are videos on almost all social media platforms, and it is a particularly persuasive way of communication. Video is a creative way to share information that is both engaging and powerful; it is a practice of translating information into moving images and making bite-sized content that has continuity while introducing new ways of storytelling.

At RNW Media, we are aware of the power that media has in communicating and informing on specific social issues, as well as its capacity to influence people and drive social change. To understand how to reach your goals, it’s essential to know how to craft engaging stories, identify the audiences you are trying to reach, and play creatively with the different platforms available to share the content. To achieve this, our course will help content creators find a way of organizing and thinking about their work that can help in achieving creative and social goals.

After this training, you will be able to understand the audio-visual medium and master the basics of video production. This course delves into the potentials and challenges of recording and strategies to innovate in content and form. We provide practical tools and techniques that can help turn your message into immersive, compelling videos.

We provide practical tools and techniques that can help turn your message into immersive, compelling videos.
After completing this training, you will be able to:
Understand our approach to video creation
Formulate a production plan that aligns with our production process
Use the basics of photography to record video
Use the basics of editing software to edit video
Develop insight into how audiences consume videos on different platforms
Explore virality as a tool for social change

location.name: RNTC Media Training Centre, part of RNW Media

content.text: We are in the midst of an information crisis. Facts, our most trusted tool, are now often not powerful enough to persuade. So, when facts and fact-checking alone is not enough, what else can be done to turn the tide? As targets of state-sponsored or hate-group online trolling, civil society actors face intimidation and lack the proper tools, knowledge, or support mechanisms that can help them fight back. Given the growth of disinformation, targeted campaigns, and smear tactics used online, it is becoming crucial for CSOs to learn the tools in countering disinformation.

We have provided countering disinformation training for the last 5 years and have developed practical toolkits for journalists and those working in the digital information space. Our trainings have been applied and used in 22 countries fighting a range of disinformation issues from LGBTQI+ exclusion, anti-abortion campaigns, and Covid-19 disinformation.

This course equips you with the practical tools to combat disinformation, build counter-narratives, utilize fact-checking tools, and increase outreach in local media. Combining innovative techniques on media literacy, alternate messaging, and campaigning, we showcase what can be done to fight back.

Unpack the causes and drivers of mis-, dis- and mal-information
Create effective strategies that address the root of hate messaging linked to SRHR content
Explore techniques on how to design emotional counter-narratives using effective examples
Use influencer networks and amplification to spread positive alternate messaging

products.title: Introduction to Digital Safety and Security - Online

content.text: Introductions and Icebreaker Activity
Basic Concepts & Principles
Physical & Digital Security
Individual Assignment: Build your Security Guidelines
Q&A and Wrap-up

In today's interconnected world, safeguarding your digital presence is paramount. This 3-hour masterclass is designed for NGO workers, activists, and human rights defenders with little to no prior knowledge of digital safety and security. It's a fundamental course that empowers you with the knowledge and mindset needed to protect yourself, your colleagues, and your partners' privacy and security.

In today's interconnected world, safeguarding your digital presence is paramount. This 3-hour masterclass is designed for NGO workers, activists, and human rights defenders with little to no prior knowledge of digital safety and security. It's a fundamental course that empowers you with the knowledge and mindset needed to protect yourself, your colleagues, and your partners' privacy and security.
By the end of the masterclass, I can:
Differentiate between security, safety, and privacy
Use a digital safety and security mindset and principles to guide my decisions on- and offline
List threats to their physical and digital security, as well as tools to mitigate them
Elaborate security guidelines to protect myself, my colleagues, and my partners

location.name: RNTC Media Training Centre, part of RNW Media

products.title: Inclusive Design: Creating Accessible Digital Content
products.english_title: Inclusive Design: Creating Accessible Digital Content

content.text: We aim to ensure that every person can access, use, and enjoy digital content and platforms. Designed for digital content creators, media-makers, and all individuals involved in the development of digital platforms, this masterclass centres on understanding disability and accessibility standards to guarantee an equitable digital experience. By the end of the masterclass, you will be equipped to critically assess your content and establish clear goals for making it more accessible to diverse users. Embark on a transformative journey in our masterclass, where we explore disability awareness and accessibility in the digital realm.

Dive into the Social Model of Disability, gaining insights into perceiving accessibility through a nuanced lens. In a group exercise, navigate various categories of disabilities, from visual and auditory to motor and intellectual.

Uncover accessibility principles and basic criteria, laying the groundwork for creating inclusive digital experiences. Apply your knowledge in a case study analysis, bridging theory with real-world scenarios.

Take a moment for personal reflection in an individual exercise, evaluating the accessibility of your content. By the end of this 2-hours masterclass, you will be ready to embark on a path of creating universally resonant digital content.

We aim to ensure that every person can access, use, and enjoy digital content and platforms. Designed for digital content creators, media-makers, and all individuals involved in the development of digital platforms, this masterclass centres on understanding disability and accessibility standards to guarantee an equitable digital experience. By the end of the masterclass, you will be equipped to critically assess your content and establish clear goals for making it more accessible to diverse users. Embark on a transformative journey in our masterclass, where we explore disability awareness and accessibility in the digital realm.

Dive into the Social Model of Disability, gaining insights into perceiving accessibility through a nuanced lens. In a group exercise, navigate various categories of disabilities, from visual and auditory to motor and intellectual.

Uncover accessibility principles and basic criteria, laying the groundwork for creating inclusive digital experiences. Apply your knowledge in a case study analysis, bridging theory with real-world scenarios.

Take a moment for personal reflection in an individual exercise, evaluating the accessibility of your content. By the end of this 2-hours masterclass, you will be ready to embark on a path of creating universally resonant digital content.
By the end of the masterclass, I can:
Explain the social model of disability, considering the role of environmental barriers
Identify categories of disabilities and associated barriers
List accessibility criteria and their benefits for diverse users
Evaluate the accessibility levels of self-created content
